content.description: P1 - An easy jaunt up a dihedral and around an arete eventually gains a gully. A harder variation takes the obvious face crack straight up. 5.6 - 5.7 ish.P2 - Scramble the remainder of the gully, a slab with ample cracks leads to a short fun dihedral. Dihedral is the crux if you don't count the approach. 5.8.P3 - Easy cracks and some care to not pull deathblocks onto the belayer will yield a ledge. Fun offwidth to the top of the tower. 5.8.3 raps to base with a 70m rope. The last rap just barely made it, and would have required another intermediary rap with a shorter rope.
content.protection: Doubles to 3 was more than enough
content.location: Coordinates: 45.20259, -117.28969~100 ft east of a chossy red buttress, scramble up a small gully to base. Western end of Wallowa County Crag. We were looking for the Barley Cox Route on Jehovah Jireh Tower - once we got close enough we could see this wasn't it but looked fun anyway.

content.description: Lots of moderate climbing, with three prime pitches of 5.9 hand cracks.   The route has a few nice ledges on it, and climbs a buttress just east of the main south facing headwall. Once you reach the summit of the route, you can easily scramble across the ridge to the main head-wall summit.
content.location:
This climbing is visible from Lakes Basin, in the Eagle Cap Wilderness Area. You can reach lakes basin from ToPan, Hurricane Creek and Wallowa Lake Trail heads. I believe the best for approaching the cliff, is from Wallowa lake trail head and camping at Horseshoe Lake, appx 9miles.

 The photo/topo i posted is from Horseshoe lake.

content.description:
This Route Climbs the Jehovah Jireh Tower. Two 5.6 pitches lead to a third pitch of 5.7. The crux of this route is the hike in to Horseshoe Lake.  

  rap. off of the back of the tower to the notch in, down climb a little and then one final 100ft rappel to the base of route.
content.protection: Standard light rack to number three. 50 or 60 meter rope.
content.location: Just north of Horseshoe lake. Left of the major Wallowa County Crag Face. This route is the second known route at The Wallowa County Crag, the First being The Barley Hurley Route. The 10 mile hike into this climb is the crux of the route. The swimming and camping at the lake is great.
